note.para: This is not yet supported in MSWLogo when reader is [] (keyboard). See KEYBOARDON

listitem.para: Reads number characters from the read stream and outputs those characters as a word. If the read stream is a file, and the end of file is reached, READCHARS outputs the empty list (not the empty word). If the read stream is a terminal, echoing is turned off when READCHARS is invoked, and remains off until READLIST or READWORD are invoked or a Logo prompt is printed. Backslash, vertical bar, and tilde characters have no special meaning in this context.

listitem.programlisting:
OPENWRITE "dummy.fil SETWRITE "dummy.fil PRINT "Hello SETWRITE [] CLOSE "dummy.fil
OPENREAD "dummy.fil SETREAD "dummy.fil SHOW READCHARS 5 Hello
SETREAD [] CLOSE "dummy.fil
